  1. A harsh winter, the great and awful darkness preceding the end of the world as written in the Prose Edda (“Younger Edda”).   2. (transitive, with accusative) to wipe something (so as to remove moisture or unwanted material from the surface of it)

  4. (transitive, with dative, with or without qualification as to body part) to dry someone’s body, dry someone off
  5. (transitive, with dative, with qualification as to body part) to wipe some part of someone's body (e.g. wipe someone’s nose)

  2. “wiper”, referring to a windshield wiper
  3. “dryer”, referring to a hair dryer
